intro: Valeriana johannae, commonly known as Johann's valerian, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its perennial growth habit and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late summer to early autumn. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their sedative and calming properties. Valeriana johannae thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
